SENT.plain: 176 sonograms of carotid arteries are compared with the corresponding angiograms to evaluate the diagnostic possibilities of B-mode sonography in detecting arteriosclerotic vessel disease
Ultrasound tomography is proved to be a reliable method to rule out arteriosclerosis; the specificity of the investigation method is 100%
However, the diagnostic value varies concerning the visualization of different arteriosclerotic lesions
B-mode sonography is of minor significance in detecting arteriosclerotic ulcers
Fresh thrombi are often not diagnosed
The sensitivity of this investigation method therefore corresponds 85%
